value.title: Trim column headers with spaces in between words in one step in Power Query
value.excerpt: There is a trim function in Power Query to get rid of spaces at the beginning or end of a phrase, but unlike excel trim, it wont get rid of excess whitespaces between words.  In this video, I will show you how to get rid of all spaces no matter where they are on one step in power query.  Other column

value.title: PowerQuery Tips – Split Multiple Columns to Rows at Once
value.excerpt: In this vLog, we will learn about splitting multiple columns to the rows at once using the PowerQuery. We can easily split single column using the OOTB option very easily, but what if, you have multiple column which needed the split operation? At that time we need to use function Text.Split() and Table.FromColumn()

value.excerpt: Age banding is a common scenario in analytics, and I have explained how it is possible in many different ways. value.title: Be Careful When Merging on Text Fields in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: Merging two tables in Power Query is one of the most useful transformations to combine data from different datasets, and also create a flatten data structure. However, if you use a text field for merge, then you might see some unexpected results. Here in this video, I share some important considerations

value.title: Cartesian Product in Power Query   Multiply All Sets of All Pairs in Power BI
value.excerpt: Sometimes, you need to create a multiplication of all sets of all pairs from two different data tables in Power BI. value.title: Convert Flat List to Table in Power BI   Pivot Without a Set Key Column Using Power Query
value.excerpt: The scenario I am explaining today is a very specific use case, However, I have seen examples similar to this happens very often.
